result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:21 PM - Attorney Preston James Smead appeared by video means for Defendant Jordan Wayne Weil. Prosecuting Atty Lynne K Van Hollen appeared for State of Wisconsin via video. Defendant Jordan Wayne Weil appeared by video means (fr ACJ).  COVID - ZOOM; rec'd copy info, waives read, plea mute, N/G enter'd for him.  Parties may ZOOM next dte.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on Feb 28 at 1:00;  ka
Arraignment on February 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

08:30 AM Defendant Jordan Wayne Weil in court with attorney Preston James Smead.  Defendant Jordan Wayne Weil in custody in ACJ.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jordan Wayne Weil appeared by video means with Attorney.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. State calls witness, Larry Koivisko, sworn, exam by the State. Witness identified the def. Cross exam by the Atty. Redirect from the State. State moves to admit Ex 1, Ex 1 is admitted. State makes arguments. Atty makes arguments. 
Ct finds PC the def committed a fel in Ashland County and case is bound over for argnment. State will file info shortly. Atty would like argment at a later date.  Arraignment scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
11:11 AM Defendant Jordan Wayne Weil in court with attorney Preston James Smead.  Defendant Jordan Wayne Weil in custody.  David V. Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jordan Wayne Weil appeared by video means with Attorney.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. Atty appears for a special appr for today's hearing. Back on the record (11:23am) The def now appears from the ACJ. Def rec'd compl, Will waive TL for prelim at this time. Ct finds the def know and vol waives TL for prelim. 
If hearing is not going to be done by ZOOM atty need to let JA know,  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to have NO CONTACT with S.S. or any female under age 18.
Defendant not be be within 100 ft of S.S. or their address.
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
Defendant not to go into any bars, taverns, liquor dotores or any place where the primary sale is alcohol or mind altering substances.
